intro: Isabelia pulchella f. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered Isabelia, is a rare and striking plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white. The plant features large, velvety leaves with a deep green color and a slightly waxy texture. Its flowers are typically borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
